data.title: [WelcomeUX] Clicking into welcome editor does not make it active
data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19111

* move the welcome editor to another group and make the first group active
* click into welcome editor
=> group that belongs to welcome editor is not getting active

This works for markdown preview so there is something missing to make the focus work. I wonder if this is `tabindex`, though I do not see it defined in the webview part either.

Could also be this: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/html/browser/webview-pre.js#L46

data.title: Switching workspaces produces error in extension host
data.body:
Seeing this since today when switching folders:

```
[3164:0124/065507:INFO:CONSOLE(228)] "%c[Extension Host]", source: file:////Users/bpasero/Development/Microsoft/monaco/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/extensionHost.js (228)
Uncaught Exception:  Error: This socket has been ended by the other party
Error: This socket has been ended by the other party
	at Socket.writeAfterFIN [as write] (net.js:286:12)
	at Immediate.<anonymous> (/Users/bpasero/Development/Microsoft/monaco/out/vs/base/parts/ipc/node/ipc.net.js:121:34)
	at runCallback (timers.js:574:20)
	at tryOnImmediate (timers.js:554:5)
	at processImmediate [as _immediateCallback] (timers.js:533:5)
```

data.title: Welcome: shorten home path with ~ (Linux, macOS)
data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19111

Just an idea to maybe align our display of recent paths to use "~" if it matches the home path:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/22246149/a94985ca-e233-11e6-9fde-d197ba60ed13.png)

data.title: Cannot undo skipping of file
data.body: re #19096 See above screen shot: Once I have skipped `applib.js` I can never undo that because it won't ever appear in my call stack. I need to restart the debugger

data.title: Sass error: '} expected'
[WelcomeUX] Quick links uses two different fonts
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: macOS

While testing #19111:

The header of a Quick link uses a different font than the description:
![2017-01-24_12-40-12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/22245934/b8b124ec-e232-11e6-912c-eab8eaaa9419.png)

But the difference is so small (at least on macOS), that it just looks broken.
If we really want to use two different fonts, then they should really differ.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] lots of errors from ESLint in welcome playground
data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19111

Looks like ESLint is not super happy about the contents of the playground:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/22246020/0faa6146-e233-11e6-9f7a-4818d72d58bc.png)

Maybe we can somehow relax the rules for the playground?

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Many unbound commands on Linux?
data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19111

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/22245911/9bdd9c42-e232-11e6-8d20-26840733e368.png)

I think we need some fallback strategy for unbound commands? Maybe a hint how to invoke the command from the command palette instead?

data.title: [WelcomeUX] "Rename Refactoring" link does nothing
data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19111

Clicking on that link from the playground does not move anywhere (I was running on Linux).

data.title: Weird wording: Toggle skipping this file
data.body:
re #19096

The context menu contains an entry 'Toggle skipping this file' which is very weird wording. Toggle shouldn't be in the label but the label should toggle: 'Skip this file' and 'Antonyms(skip) this file' (whatever the reverse of skip should be, include?)

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Page is not localizable
data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19111

It looks like we need a story for localizing our welcome page.

data.title: [css] provide css formatter

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs #19047

Our css does not support formating a range, thus `formatOnPaste` is useless for CSS.
And this is actually the only use case I personally have for `formatOnPaste`, since I always copy rules from chrome dev tools and they are always wrongly indented. However `formatOnPaste` does not help me here

data.title: Welcome: overlay is not in sync with what is going on in the workbench
data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19111

Our UI is dynamic, not only in the viewlet bar but also status bar. The overlay will quickly get out of sync:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/22245696/9f18ccac-e231-11e6-9fcd-dc36b2451aa8.png)

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Linux overlay has a bug with keybindings in the lower left corner
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19111

See how the keybinding is not aligned:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/22245668/692fa16a-e231-11e6-8d5c-c93254a2edee.png)

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Shows up in command palette but not Help  menu
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19111

There is an entry to show "Welcome" from the command palette but I do not find an entry in the Help menu.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Do not open browser if welcome is showing
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19111

If the welcome experience is showing I would not expect that we open code.visualstudio.com externally.

data.title: Unable to write to dirty settings file
data.body:
Now we have more and more menu actions that write immediatly to settings, for instance toggle word wrap.
If you have a dirty settings.json all these actions are broken as I always get the erros that I am unable to write to a dirty settings file

I believe this can hurt a lot of our users as they usualy do not have auto save on, and showing an error message in this case looks bad imho.

![screen shot 2017-01-24 at 12 26 32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/22245529/a03d01b2-e230-11e6-97d5-b88235a0befb.png)

data.title: editor.formatOnPaste wording
data.body:
refs #19047

As far as I understand this feature will only be respected for languages that support format ranges.
I believe a second sentence should be added to the setting description in order to expain this.
Similar to how `formatOnSave` explains when it is applicable

It would also be cool if in our docs we have a list of languages that support format range so the user after googling could easily find this list

![screen shot 2017-01-24 at 12 22 33](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/22245387/e46cad16-e22f-11e6-929b-5ea8bf08192b.png)

data.title: Debugging yeoman: no breakpoint is hit
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19039

* check out our code generator (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-generator-code)
* npm install
* generate a config to debug the yo man generator
* add a breakpoint e.g. into index.js line 43 or even the constructor
* run it
=> no breakpoint hit for me

data.title: Built-in JavaScript extension gets disabled by disabling an extension that depends on it
data.body:
Version 1.9.0-insider
Commit 61a56dbf6e80b6732381349e4654e3ae5f0710f4
Date 2017-01-24T08:05:06.845Z

- install the 'JavaScript Atom grammar' extension from the market place
- disable the grammar
- The dialog asks if dependencies should be disabled as well. Say yes.
- After starting VSCode open a .js file.
The editor does not detect the file type but shows 'plain text' instead.

The built-in JavaScript extension is a dependency of JavaScript Atom grammar as it defines the javascript language id.

There is no UI to see that the JavaScript extension is disabled, and no UI to enable again.

data.title: Debugger behaves weird in this case
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19039

* clone https://github.com/expressjs/express
* npm install
* create an empty launch.json and fill it with mocha
* use test as folder not tests
* set a breakpoint into app.render.js line 20
* hit F5
* notice how things work and break
* stop debugging
* open settings and change to show inline values
* click on app.render.js
* hit F5
=> now you suddenly hit an error that "describe" is not defined?
=> you cannot debug the tests anymore

data.title: Search results do not update when the settings.json file is edited
data.body:
Testing: #19059

Related: #19154

* Search for fontSize
* Type fontSize
> The newly typed text is not highlighted as a search result until the search is re-run.

![search-not-updated](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/22244589/79987a5e-e22c-11e6-9c48-92e9a5b67d8e.gif)

data.title: Mocha launch config: suggest to use "test" as folder
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19039

Looking at popular node.js projects it seems that tests go into a "test" folder, not "tests.

data.title: Replace in settings shows wrong search decoration
data.body:
Testing #19059 

Related: #19152

Notice how the editor decoration is out of position, as if the 4 spaces were a tab (i.e. off by 3 chars).

![replace-in-settings-spaces](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/22244404/c06b6b90-e22b-11e6-94cc-061fc7552cf2.gif)

data.title: Double clicking the Markdown preview shouldn't scroll unnecessarily
data.body:
Testing #19085 

Notice the text editor scrolling around in the left. IMO the cursor should change, but if it's already in view, the editor shouldn't scroll.

![kapture 2017-01-24 at 11 53 51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/22244417/c9e8bd12-e22b-11e6-9887-ec633e487293.gif)

data.title: Replace in Settings introduces spaces in file indented with tabs
data.body:
Testing #19059

My `settings.json` is correctly formatted with tabs.
Choose any "Replace in Settings" action causes the `settings.json` to contain spaces.

![replace-in-settings-spaces](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/22244404/c06b6b90-e22b-11e6-94cc-061fc7552cf2.gif)

data.title: Quote blocks should be highlighted in Markdown too
data.body:
Testing #19085

Images and paragraphs seem highlighted as the mouse moves around.

Quote blocks should be too.

```
> foo

foo

> foo

foo

> foo

foo
foo
foo

> foo

> foo
```

![kapture 2017-01-24 at 11 51 05](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/22244333/66ebd21c-e22b-11e6-9d73-3e3381883656.gif)

data.title: 'reindent all lines': wrong indent with object literal
data.body:
Testing #18958:
- in the vscode repo, open 'themeService.ts'
- run 'reindent all lines'.
- Note the change on defaultThemeColors:
```
let defaultThemeColors: { [baseTheme: string]: IThemeSetting[] } = {
	'vs': [
	{ scope: 'token.info-token', settings: { foreground: '#316bcd' } },
	{ scope: 'token.warn-token', settings: { foreground: '#cd9731' } },
	{ scope: 'token.error-token', settings: { foreground: '#cd3131' } },
	{ scope: 'token.debug-token', settings: { foreground: 'purple' } }
	],
```

data.title: No language setting code assist when editing workspace setting manually
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

Test: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19060

- VSCode Version: 1.9
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open workspace settings=
2. Type
```json
{
	"[ma<code complete]"
}
```

Would expect to get code complete here proposing markdown.

data.title: Clicking on user settings / workspace settings should focus the editor, not the search bar
data.body:
Testing #19059

* open settings
* click into the editor (it shows user settings)
* realize you'd like to change a workspace setting
* click on workspace settings
> Focus is now in the search and not in the editor. This is not how other tabs in our UI work.
